servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: P2127: Throttle / Pedal Position Sensor / Switch “E” Circuit Low Input

entry.ptxt: APP sensor (sub) signal circuit voltage is lower than 0.60 V.

ptxt.emph: P2128: Throttle / Pedal Position Sensor / Switch “E” Circuit High Input

entry.ptxt: APP sensor (sub) signal circuit voltage is higher than 4.82 V.

attention3.ptxt: Make sure that the following conditions are satisfied when using this procedure.

s1.ptxt: Depress accelerator pedal fully, and release it.

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:N32A .

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) mounting check

test1.ptxt: Check that accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) has been mounted to vehicle body properly (no pinched floor carpet, etc.).

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Reinstall accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) properly.

testgroup.title: APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, disconnect connector from accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor).
Check for proper terminal connection to accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) connector.
If connections are OK, turn ON ignition switch to ON position.
Check that voltage between APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit (B1) and vehicle body ground is 5 V.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

testgroup.title: APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Check that voltage between APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit (B1) and ground circuit (B3) is 5 V.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

paragroup.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.
If this DTC is detected again, go to Step 8.

testgroup.title: APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect connectors from ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit (B1) is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance of APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit is infinity between accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) connector and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit terminal and other terminal at APP sensor connector.
Circuit voltage of APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect connectors from ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that APP sensor signal circuit (B2) is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is infinity between accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) connector and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between APP sensor (sub) signal circuit terminal and other terminal at accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) connector.
Circuit voltage of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.
Replace accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor).

testgroup.title: Troubleshooting of other DTC(s) detected at the same time
testgroup.question: Is other DTC(s) detected together?

action.ptxt: Go to troubleshooting for applicable DTC.
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
